panels.description: Plot of Right Ascension in degrees vs loadtime. This is the value instructed to be loaded at loadtime by the phase centre controller.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "phase_centre_controller")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "ra_deg")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Right Ascension (degrees) instructed by Phase Centre Controller

panels.description: Plot of Declination in degrees vs loadtime. This is the value instructed to be loaded at loadtime by the phase centre controller.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "phase_centre_controller")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "dec_deg")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Declination (degrees) instructed by Phase Centre Controller

panels.description: The sideband values the phase centre controller is putting out for the delay model to track with.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "phase_centre_controller")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "sideband")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["tune"] == "0" or r["tune"] == "1")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Phase Centre Controller sideband values

panels.description: The sslo values the phase centre controller is putting out for the delay model to track with.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "phase_centre_controller")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "sslo")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["tune"] == "0" or r["tune"] == "1")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Phase Centre Controller sslo values

panels.description: Plot of Right Ascension in degrees vs loadtime. This is the value received by the delay model from the source finder. The current model delays set to load at loadtime are calculated for this right ascension. Note that there may be up to 5s before the F-Engines reflect these delays as that is the average loadtime.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_pointing")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "deg_ra")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Right Ascension (degrees)

panels.description: The declination vs loadtime. This is the value received by the delay model from the source finder. The current model delays are calculated for this declination. Note that there may be up to 5s before the F-Engines reflect these delays as that is the average loadtime.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_pointing")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "deg_dec")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Declination (degrees)

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "fix_paths")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "fixed_delay_path")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Path on disk to currently loaded delays

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "fix_paths")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "fixed_phase_path")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Path on disk to currently loaded phases

panels.description:
States are:
Good = delay tracking thread is initialised and turned on to track.
Bad = delay tracking thread is initialised but has not been turned to track - likely means thread failed due to F-Engine timing.
Off = delay tracking thread is not even initialised - likely means F-Engine is not configured and in operation.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_state")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "tracking_alive")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "ea01" or r["ant"] == "ea02" or r["ant"] == "ea03" or r["ant"] == "ea04" or r["ant"] == "ea05" or r["ant"] == "ea06" or r["ant"] == "ea07" or r["ant"] == "ea08" or r["ant"] == "ea09" or r["ant"] == "ea10" or r["ant"] == "ea11" or r["ant"] == "ea12" or r["ant"] == "ea13" or r["ant"] == "ea14" or r["ant"] == "ea15" or r["ant"] == "ea16" or r["ant"] == "ea17" or r["ant"] == "ea18" or r["ant"] == "ea19" or r["ant"] == "ea20" or r["ant"] == "ea21" or r["ant"] == "ea22" or r["ant"] == "ea23" or r["ant"] == "ea24" or r["ant"] == "ea25" or r["ant"] == "ea26" or r["ant"] == "ea27" or r["ant"] == "ea28")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: State of delay tracking across all antenna

panels.description:
Determined by:
|sum_frequencies(sum_antenna(gains))| / sum_frequencies(sum_antenna(|gains|))

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "fix_paths")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "calibration_grade")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Total Calibration grade

panels.description: An aggregate for all F-Engine streams of whether the F-Shift applied matches that which is broadcast from mcast. This being Bad is not necessarily indicative of anything broken, as if the system is not recording, it will not load the currently broadcast fshifts to the F-Engines.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_state")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "fshifts_correct")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: ${Antenna} F-shift status

panels.description: An aggregate for all F-Engine streams of whether the Delays applied are correct for the current sample time. This is calculated by reading delays off of the F-Engine sometime after loading and checking that they match the expected interpolated value. The delays are the sum of the calibration fixed delays and geometric.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_state")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "delay_correct")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: ${Antenna} loading correct delays

panels.description: An aggregate for all F-Engine streams of whether the Phases applied are correct for the current sample time. This is calculated by reading phases off of the F-Engine sometime after loading and checking that they match the expected interpolated value These are the phases derived from the applied delay during tracking.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_state")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "phase_correct")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: ${Antenna} Phase status

panels.description: Whether delays are loaded at the loadtime specified by the delay model. This is tested by checking the time_since_loaded value for the delays on the F-Engines corresponds to loadtime instructed.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_state")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "loadtime_accurate")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: ${Antenna} Loadtime status

panels.description: Whether the phase calibration values calculated during the calibration run that are expected to have been loaded are loaded. This is checked in every calibration run, half a second after instructing the delay tracking thread to load the calibration delays.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_state")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "phase_cal_correct")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.title: ${Antenna} Phase Calibration Values Loaded status

panels.description: The F-Shift value loaded at present on the antenna for stream 0. Check the F-Shifts correct panel for information about whether this matches what is broadcast on mcast.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_values")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "loaded_fshift_hz")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["stream"] == "0")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: F-Shifts loaded for ${Antenna} stream 0

panels.description: The F-Shift value loaded at present for the antenna on stream 1. Check the F-Shifts correct panel for information about whether this matches what is broadcast on mcast.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_values")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "loaded_fshift_hz")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["stream"] == "1")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: F-Shifts loaded for ${Antenna} strean 1

panels.description: The tracking mode for the antenna.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_state")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "tracking_mode")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: ${Antenna} Tracking Mode

panels.description: An aggregate for all F-Engine tunings of whether the sideband being used for phase calculations on the F-Engine matches that received from the delay model for that sample time.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "tune_values")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "current_sideband")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["tune"] == "0" or r["tune"] == "1")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: ${Antenna} Sideband status

panels.description: The state of the tracking status. If good, this means that tracking has been switched on for the antenna - the mode of which is visible in the tracking mode panel.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_state")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "tracking_ok")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: ${Antenna} Tracking status

panels.description: This panel dictates if the tracking thread is even alive for this antenna which if False, indicates that the antenna may be out of commission.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_state")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "tracking_alive")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.title: ${Antenna} Tracking Alive

panels.description: The F-Shift value loaded at present for the antenna on stream 2. Check the F-Shifts correct panel for information about whether this matches what is broadcast on mcast.

from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_values")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "loaded_fshift_hz")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["stream"] == "2")

panels.title: F-Shifts loaded for ${Antenna} stream 2

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_values")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "loaded_fshift_hz")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")

panels.title: F-Shifts loaded for ${Antenna} stream 3

panels.description:
Expected and firmware delays across all F-Engine streams for the antenna. 
Firmware delays are calculated by reading fractional and coarse delays off of the F-Engines.
Expected delays are calculated by knowing what calibration delay and geometric delay coefficients were loaded, interpolating the geometric delays to a the time of reading from the F-Engine and comparing.
This is the cumulative delays i.e. Calibration delays + geometric delays.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_values")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "firmware_delay_ns")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["stream"] == "0" or r["stream"] == "1" or r["stream"] == "2" or r["stream"] == "3")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_values")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "expected_delay_ns")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["stream"] == "0" or r["stream"] == "1" or r["stream"] == "2" or r["stream"] == "3")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Delays applied on ${Antenna}

panels.description: The calibration delays produced via the calibration process and sent out to be loaded to F-Engines within half a second. Note that these values will differ from those in the .csv file as they are offset by (8e3/(0.66 * c))*1e9 ns.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "fix_delays")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "fixed_delay_ns")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["stream"] == "0" or r["stream"] == "1" or r["stream"] == "2" or r["stream"] == "3")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Calibration delays to be applied to ${Antenna}

panels.description: The calculated geometric delay (1st order coefficient) produced via the delaymodel process and sent out to be loaded to F-Engines at loadtime.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_coeff")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "delay_ns")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.title: First order Geometric delays to be applied to ${Antenna}

panels.description: The calculated geometric delay (2nd order coefficient) produced via the delaymodel process and sent out to be loaded to F-Engines at loadtime.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_coeff")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "delay_rate_nsps")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.title: Second order Geometric delays to be applied to ${Antenna}

panels.description: The calculated geometric delay (3rd order coefficient) produced via the delaymodel process and sent out to be loaded to F-Engines at loadtime.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_coeff")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "delay_raterate_nsps2")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.title: Third order Geometric delays to be applied to ${Antenna}

panels.description:
Expected and firmware phases across all F-Engine streams for the antenna. 
Firmware phases are calculated by reading loaded phases off of the F-Engines.
Expected phases are calculated by knowing what phases and rates were loaded, interpolating the geometric delays to a the time of reading from the F-Engine and comparing.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_values")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "expected_phase_rad")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["stream"] == "0" or r["stream"] == "1" or r["stream"] == "2" or r["stream"] == "3")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

from(bucket: "delays")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "delay_values")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "firmware_phase_rad")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["ant"] == "${Antenna}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["stream"] == "0" or r["stream"] == "1" or r["stream"] == "2" or r["stream"] == "3")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Phases applied to ${Antenna}

list.name: Antenna
list.query: ea01, ea02, ea03, ea04, ea05, ea06, ea07, ea08, ea09, ea10, ea11, ea12, ea13, ea14, ea15, ea16, ea17, ea18, ea19, ea20, ea21, ea22, ea23, ea24, ea25, ea26, ea27, ea28
